headline.main: Brazil's Middle Class Finds a Lifeline at the Pawnshop
headline.print_headline: Brazil’s Middle Class Finds a Lifeline at the Pawnshop

docs.abstract: With credit cards charging more than 240 percent interest a year, middle-class Brazilians are increasingly turning to a place where collateral is king.
docs.snippet: With credit cards charging more than 240 percent interest a year, middle-class Brazilians are increasingly turning to a place where collateral is king.

docs.lead_paragraph: Catherine Lajara had no connections, no college degree and $4,000 in savings when she decided to start her own business in 2010.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's second-largest health insurer has changed its corporate name to Anthem from Wellpoint to reflect a label familiar to consumers shopping for coverage.

headline.print_headline: Health Insurer WellPoint Switches Name to Anthem

docs.lead_paragraph: The House rushed through a last-minute measure Wednesday to extend a massive package of expired tax breaks for banks, investment firms, commuters and NASCAR track owners.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tea Party Republicans who led the charge into a 16-day government shutdown last year are now taking a more pragmatic approach as they weigh options on how to fight President Barack Obama's immigration order.

docs.lead_paragraph: As another round of fiscal brinkmanship looms with Republican control of Congress, the impact on tax policy, government programs and the overall economy could be severe.

headline.main: Uncertainty in Washington Poses Long List of Economic Perils
headline.print_headline: Uncertainty in Washington Poses Long List of Economic Perils

docs.abstract: Threat of fiscal brinksmanship in Washington looms over economy once again as Republicans prepare to take control of Congress; uncertainty over budget presents a significant threat to delicate economic recovery.
docs.snippet: As another round of fiscal brinkmanship looms with Republican control of Congress, the impact on tax policy, government programs and the overall economy could be severe.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama urged Congress on Tuesday to approve $6.18 billion to help fight the Ebola outbreak, reminding them that even though the story has faded from the headlines, the battle against the virus is far from over.

headline.main: Obama Urges Congress to Approve $6 Billion for Ebola Fight
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Congress to Approve $6 Billion for Ebola Fight

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama urged Congress on Tuesday to approve $6.18 billion to help fight the Ebola outbreak, reminding them that even though the story has faded from the headlines, the battle against the virus is far from over.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tough new rules to make banks safer after the credit crisis are imperfect and could boost less-regulated activities in the so-called shadow banking system, a top U.S. government research group said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Tight New Rules May Boost Shadow Banks, U.S. Risk Watchdog Warns
headline.print_headline: Tight New Rules May Boost Shadow Banks, U.S. Risk Watchdog Warns

docs.snippet: Tough new rules to make banks safer after the credit crisis are imperfect and could boost less-regulated activities in the so-called shadow banking system, a top U.S. government research group said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The senior Senate Republican on Tuesday raised the possibility of Congress writing comprehensive healthcare legislation if the Supreme Court next year strikes down a subsidy provision of Obamacare.

headline.main: Top Senate Republican Sees Possible Major Healthcare Legislation

docs.snippet: The senior Senate Republican on Tuesday raised the possibility of Congress writing comprehensive healthcare legislation if the Supreme Court next year strikes down a subsidy provision of Obamacare.
